remarks: A stronger form of ~ pwuninel .  We can use ~ pwuninel , ~ 2pwuninel to create one or two sets disjoint from a given set ` A ` , but here we show that in fact such constructions exist for arbitrarily large disjoint extensions, which is to say that for any set ` B ` we can construct a set ` x ` that is equinumerous to it and disjoint from ` A ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Feb-2015.)
